thread.section_title: MP films panic as gunshots are fired during London terror attack – Metro
thread.title: MP films panic as gunshots are fired during London terror attack
thread.title_full: MP films panic as gunshots are fired during London terror attack

author: georgiadiebelius1
title: MP films panic as gunshots are fired during London terror attack
text:
He filmed himself running (Picture: Wales Online) MPs were caught on camera fleeing after hearing gunshots while walking to the House of Commons this afternoon.
Monmouth MP David Davies ran through Westminster warning others to ‘get back’ and ‘run’.
Hero MP Tobias Ellwood helped to save life of officer stabbed in London terror attack He filmed the panic on his mobile phone.
At the time of the incident, which has left one dead and several with catastrophic injuries, he had been walking with fellow Tory MP Grant Shapps from their offices in Portcullis House.
They were on their way to vote in the House of Commons when the shots were fired.
&&&&& To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
Monmouth MP David Davies recorded the clip (Picture: PA) Police opened fire and shot a person outside the Houses of Parliament (Picture: Caters) An armed police officer stands on Parliament Square outside of the Houses of Parliament (Picture: AP Photo/Kirsty Wigglesworth) A policeman was stabbed and died (Picture: Yui Mok/PA Wire) Throughout the footage, Davies can be heard urging: ‘Don’t go out there. Someone has opened fire.’
While sprinting through Westminster he asks: ‘Is he coming?’
Police appeal for photos and video of Parliament terror attack Speaking to Wales Online , he said: ‘I’m not sure how many shots there were – someone said four. It was certainly more than one, and I thought “this is not good”.
‘I don’t know whether it was the police firing at an assailant or someone shooting at people.
‘I thought it was best to get away as quickly as possible, so I went back to Portcullis House. There were lots of people milling around.’
Following the incident at around 2.45pm this afternoon, at least one person has died and a number of others have been hurt.
People were hit on Westminster Bridge (Picture: Metro) A total of four people have died (Picture: Stefan Rousseau/PA Wire) The area is on lockdown What happened outside Parliament A policeman has died after being stabbed and his apparent attacker was shot by officers in a major security incident at the Houses of Parliament.
Around three shots rang out outside the Palace of Westminster after a man ran through the gates into the front yard of the parliamentary compound apparently waving a knife.
Two people were seen being treated on the ground in New Palace Yard amid shouts and screams.
An air ambulance landed in Parliament Square and a regular ambulance came in through the front gates as medics rushed to help the injured people.
Armed police cleared the area around the incident and Parliament Square was closed to traffic.
Scotland Yard said the attack in Westminster was being treated ‘as a terrorist incident until we know otherwise’.
Up to one dozen people were also injured after a car mowed down people on Westminster Bridge.
In total, four people have died and a number of others have been hurt – including some with ‘catastrophic’ injuries – a junior doctor at St Thomas’ Hospital has said.
Reports are now coming in that a second person has died and a woman has been pulled from the River Thames alive.
Four dead including police officer in London terror attack A police officer has also been stabbed and his apparent attacker shot by officers in a major security incident at the Houses of Parliament. A total of three officers are believed to have been injured.
Around three shots rang out outside the Palace of Westminster after a man ran through the gates into the front yard of the parliamentary compound apparently waving a knife.
There are also reports of people being seen in the river following the attack which happened on the anniversary of the Brussels attack.
